definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
(music) accidental (symbol such as a sharp (♯), flat (♭), natural (♮) etc)

sentences.english: The gunman notched up five victims on the handle of his gun.
sentences.chinese: 槍手在自己的槍柄上刻上5個受害者的記號。

sentences.english: The cards were marked,so I got cleaned.
A black dress person into Cao Zhai night, stole Cao Fu a picture, and leave a mark.
sentences.chinese: 一黑衣人夜入曹宅，盜走曹父的一幅畫，並留下記號。

sentences.english: Lily: Pass me the marker, please.
The hackers then follow their marks as they move to their online bank accounts.
sentences.chinese: 黑客就可以根據木馬留下的記號跟蹤他們的網銀賬號。

sentences.english: My sword fell into the river at this marked place.
sentences.chinese: 我的寶劍是從這個刻着記號的地方掉下去的。

sentences.english: She marked the date on her calendar.
sentences.chinese: 她在她的行事曆上給那個日期做記號。

sentences.english: She rubbed the key with a cloth, but the mark did not go away.
sentences.chinese: 她用布去擦鑰匙上的記號，但是擦不掉。

sentences.english: I am not going to add it because the notation is already long enough.
sentences.chinese: 我不打算加它，因爲記號已經夠長了。

sentences.english: And thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand， and they shall be as frontlets between thine eyes.
sentences.chinese: 也要系在手上爲記號，戴在額上爲經文。

sentences.english: Later on we will combine token sequences into parse trees.
sentences.chinese: 稍後我們會將記號序列組合成解析樹。

sentences.english: Island bag on my, and everyone will command the sign of the quest get start.
sentences.chinese: 島袋一聲令下，人人就依據本人獲得的記號開端尋寶。

sentences.english: A berserker wizard gets no score for treasure.
sentences.chinese: 一個狂暴的巫術師得不到珍貴的記號。

sentences.english: It is in complex notation and so on.
sentences.chinese: 它是有複雜的記號等等。

sentences.english: Use a piece of paper and a pen to mark down movements.
sentences.chinese: 每一次寶寶有動作即在紙上作一記號。

definition: to dismantle/to disassemble/to open up (sth sealed)/to unpick
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
(of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
